Name: DVIR Form: Chevrolet Silverado
Description: Driver Vehicle Inspection Report for Chevrolet Silverado with Extended Compliance and Preventive Maintenance Checks

Items.Name: Headlights (both beams functional)
Items.Comment: Check high and low beam operation

Items.Name: Turn Signals (left and right)
Items.Comment: Check all four turn signal lights

Items.Name: Brake Lights (both sides)
Items.Comment: Verify operation during braking

Items.Name: Reflectors and Reflective Tape
Items.Comment: Check side reflectors and tape condition

Items.Name: Side Mirrors (condition and adjustment)
Items.Comment: Check for cracks, loose mounting

Items.Name: Rear View Mirror (interior)
Items.Comment: Check condition and adjustment

Items.Name: Windshield Wipers (operation and condition)
Items.Comment: Test both speeds and check blade wear

Items.Name: Windshield (cracks / damage)
Items.Comment: Check for obstructions in driver view

Items.Name: Tire Front Left (pressure / tread / damage)
Items.Comment: Check for proper inflation and wear

Items.Name: Tire Front Right (pressure / tread / damage)
Items.Comment: Check for proper inflation and wear

Items.Name: Tire Rear Left (pressure / tread / damage)
Items.Comment: Check for proper inflation and wear

Items.Name: Tire Rear Right (pressure / tread / damage)
Items.Comment: Check for proper inflation and wear

Items.Name: Spare Tire (condition / securely mounted)
Items.Comment: Verify secure mounting and no damage

Items.Name: Wheels and Rims (condition / missing lug nuts)
Items.Comment: Check for bent rims, missing or loose lugs

Items.Name: Steering Wheel (no play / smooth operation)
Items.Comment: Check for excessive play and binding

Items.Name: Service Brake (foot brake responsiveness)
Items.Comment: Test brake engagement and effectiveness

Items.Name: Brake Pedal (travel / feel)
Items.Comment: Check pedal response and firmness

Items.Name: Parking Brake (engagement and hold)
Items.Comment: Verify secure holding and smooth engagement

Items.Name: Suspension System (visible damage / unusual noise)
Items.Comment: Check springs, shocks, and control arms

Items.Name: Exhaust System (leaks / damage / loose)
Items.Comment: Check for holes, rust, and secure mounting

Items.Name: Frame and Undercarriage (rust / damage / cracks)
Items.Comment: Visible inspection from ground level

Items.Name: Body Damage (dents / scratches / rust)
Items.Comment: Check exterior condition

Items.Name: Doors and Hardware (operation / latches)
Items.Comment: Check door locks, latches, and hinges

Items.Name: Cab Interior Seating (condition / secure)
Items.Comment: Check seat attachment and condition

Items.Name: Safety Equipment (fire extinguisher / warning triangles)
Items.Comment: Verify presence and accessibility

Items.Name: Tow Hitch (condition / secure / safety pin)
Items.Comment: Check for damage, corrosion, and security

Items.Name: Engine Oil Level (proper level)
Items.Comment: Check when engine is cold or after warm cooldown

Items.Name: Coolant Level (proper level / no leaks)
Items.Comment: Check when engine is cool

Items.Name: Brake Fluid Level (proper level)
Items.Comment: Check when vehicle is on level ground

Items.Name: Transmission Fluid (proper level / color)
Items.Comment: Check color for condition

Items.Name: Battery Condition (terminals / corrosion / secure)
Items.Comment: Check for corrosion, loose connections, damage

Items.Name: Belts and Hoses (cracks / fraying / leaks)
Items.Comment: Check serpentine belt and radiator hoses

Items.Name: Air Filter Condition (clean / serviceable)
Items.Comment: Check visible condition

Items.Name: Visible Leaks (oil / coolant / brake / transmission)
Items.Comment: Check under vehicle from ground level

Items.Name: Unusual Noises or Vibrations (during operation)
Items.Comment: Note any abnormal sounds or vibrations
